Hello ECB, all of the damage shield builds flying around (all two of them) have inspired me to post one of my own. This is a re-imagining of an ancient build I created in ~2005 by the name of "True Liches Lyrics", you can find it in the old archives. Back then I was only a child, and the concepts of "reading", "learning", and "refining" had not yet entered my awareness. In fact, they still haven't, I merely wanted to post this build to spur some discussion, and perhaps you folk can help spruce it up.

The build revolves around a few things: Risen Lord form, Wounding Whispers, Curse Song, and Taunt. It could be massively improved by adding some sane classes (I.E. Palemaster), but nostalgia won't let me do it.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
I recommend dropping Great CHA 2 for Epic Reputation and ESF: Perform in order to further boost your bard song and Taunt. The +9 Perform and +3 Taunt will probably be more useful than the other bonuses from CHA. Since you don't invest in Spot you should swap Artist for SF: Perform in order to gain +1 Perform.

Lower UMD slightly so that you can put 43 points into Concentration and increase your Spellcraft to 43. Even if you won't be casting much mid-combat every caster needs Concentration. After adding the INT modifier 43 Spellcraft becomes 45 Spellcraft which gives an extra +1 to your saves vs spells.

Risen Lords get 21 STR, 19 CON, and unchanged DEX. They also get 50% Piercing DI and 50% Slashing DI which is the main advantage that this build has over a Bard/PM. [https://nwn.fandom.com/wiki/Undead_shape]

The build is designed for party play, it covers both DR tanking and bard support. Wiz25/Dru5/Shif10 is a similar DR tank that relies on damage shields to kill opponents, although that doesn't have Bard Song or Taunt so it's not as useful in a party when shifted. Combining Bard Song, Curse Song, Taunt, damage shields, high DI, and 9/- physical DR makes for a nice alternative to a standard bard. The main downside with this build is that it's a shifter, so it has a lot of limitations that non-shifter bards don't have. The only ability choices for this build are increasing DEX for higher AC or increasing CHA for higher Perform and Taunt. Since this build focuses on using damage shields and bard song as a support DR tank the higher CHA makes more sense.

The DI combined with undead immunities is the reason for choosing Risen Lord over other shapes. Stone Golem is the only real alternative and building for that requires significant changes. Once the 3 Risen Lord shifts are used up then staying in gnome form will normally be a better option than shifting into another shape, although there are some exceptions such as using Wyrmling form for elemental DI.

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
@Orion2019 , yes, Turn Undead will go through Mind Immunity.

I always thought builds that focused on forms were extremely cool.  The Risen Lord is no exception.  And there have been quite a few over the years.  I think you can even squeak out a few more AB by readjusting your pre-epic split.  Currently you have Bard6/Shifter9/Druid5.  This gives you a BAB of 13.  If you go heavy in Bard up front, you could go Bard16/Druid4, and then at 21st level take your last Druid level and then commence with Shifter.  The downside is Risen Lord comes much later.  Or you could gain just one and get Risen Lord sooner by going Bard12/Druid5/Shifter3, and then gain Undead Shape at Level 27.

Just an idea.  Not sure how married you are to your original.  My only issue with this, and it's more of a complaint with shifters in general, is that the ABs are much lower than they should be and, unless you're in a high magic world, it's hard as hades trying to keep it from flatlining.  But your combination of Bard/Curse song will help a bit.  

But also healing is an issue in Risen form.  You have to Shift to heal and that can often be traumatic (dirtnap).  Unless you got a cleric in your party who can hit you with some Harms from time to time.

As for your feat selection:  if your specialty is Risen Lord, then I'd go all in.  I would drop feats like Artist and Skill Focus Taunt and put in Weapon Focus: Scythe and Exotics.  Your Taunt is already through the roof with high Charisma, ESF, Bard and Curse Song.  Honestly, the only people who are going to have Concentration scores that high are casters who know their arse from a hole in the ground and otherworldly creatures, and in most cases you'll be able to hit them.  I would also drop two great charismas and replace it with Epic Prowess and EWF: Scythe.  I could see and argument for trying to sneak improved crit and armor skin in there, but there's really nothing left you can drop at that point.  But as a bard, you can replicate improved crit by placing Keen spell on whatever druid or Bard weapon you're using (since it will transfer to your Risen Lord scythe).

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Even if this build is rebuilt for AB it will still have very low AB. I'm not sure if it's worth changing the build for the extra boost, especially since it will heavily impact the support abilities of the build.
Bard6/Dru5/Shif9 is the best pre-epic spread for saves and it also means that Undead Shape is achievable at level 21. Even if you change the pre-epic spread to Bard16/Dru4 and get weapon feats, with +12 STR the AB is limited to +49 self-buffed, excluding Curse Song and Taunt. This requires swapping at least 4 feats (2 pre-epic and 2 epic) and delaying Undead Shape to level 33, all of which will make for a weaker support build and a harder character to level.

Current AB: 23 (BAB) + 11 (STR) + 5 (EB Bonus) + 2 (Warcry) + 2 (Bard Song) = +43
Max AB: 25 (BAB) + 11 (STR) + 4 (Feats) + 5 (EB Bonus) + 2 (Warcry) + 2 (Bard Song) = +49

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content: The trade-off is +6 AB vs 13 Perform, 7 Taunt, and easier levelling. Increasing the AB is a good idea for a solo character but for a supporting DR tank it isn't as useful. If this was rebuilt to be a DEX focused solo character then I would agree with opting for AB over skills.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
This build already has Blind Fight but it doesn't have Knockdown. After including combat feats the only spare feats are Toughness or ESF: Taunt, so you will have to drop one of them if you want Knockdown.

I tested a DEX focused solo version which is why I noticed that you don't have Tumble. Honestly I think you should stick with higher CHA if you change the build for solo play. Even if you build for AC it's still pretty mediocre (at least in a +5 AC environment), plus it makes your damage shields less useful and lowers both your Perform and Taunt.
